dublinCore.title: 113 HR 1456 IH: To make improvements to the Children’s Gasoline Burn Prevention Act.
dublinCore.rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cole (for himself, Mr. Mullin, Mr. Long, and Mr. Latta) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To make improvements to the Children’s Gasoline Burn Prevention Act.

section.header: Amendment to the Children’s Gasoline Burn Prevention Act
section.text: Section 2 of the Children’s Gasoline Burn Prevention Act (Public Law 110–278; 122 Stat. 2602) is amended—

paragraph.text:
in the heading, by striking Child-Resistant Portable Gasoline Containers and inserting
Portable Fuel Container Standards ;
by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Effective 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, each portable fuel container manufactured on or after that date for sale in the United States shall conform to the provisions of ASTM standards F852–08, F2517–09, F839–83 (2006), F976–08, F926–02 (2007), as they are by their terms applicable to gasoline, kerosene, or diesel portable fuel containers, as issued by ASTM International.

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking gasoline each place that it appears; and
in subsection (d), by striking child resistance requirements of ASTM F2517–05 and inserting provisions of any standard described in subsection (b),.
